snippet: Fund investors are rediscovering stocks in dividend-rich sectors, but the popularity of these shares is also making them expensive. So advisers suggest doing some research before buying.
abstract: Paul J Lim Fundamentally column; fund investors are turning to dividend-rich sectors of utilities, health care, real estate investment trusts and consumer companies involved in food, but advisers warn research is crucial and that focusing on dividend growth alone could be risky.
lead_paragraph: Fund investors are rediscovering stocks in dividend-rich sectors, but the popularity of these shares is also making them expensive. So advisers suggest doing some research before buying.

headline.seo: Dividend-Paying Stocks Have Become More Expensive
headline.main: Yes, They Pay a Dividend, but Can You Afford Them?
headline.print_headline: They Pay a Dividend, but Can You Afford Them?
